i1.name: Glory_in_Death
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Upon taking {{tip|Death|fatal damage}}, '''Sion''' enters {{tip|stasis}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds to {{tip|Zombie state|reanimate}} into a frenzy, restoring {{as|100% of his '''maximum''' health}} but [[Health#Health_as_a_casting_resource|losing]] {{as|{{pp|2 to 19}} health}} every {{rutngt|0.25}}, increasing by{{ft|70% of the '''base''' value|{{as|{{pp|2*0.7 to 19*0.7}} health}}}}per subsequent tick. '''Sion's''' {{stil|health regeneration}} and any {{tip|heal|healing}} (except life steal) he receives during this time is {{tt|0% effective|See notes}}.

'''Sion''' can only move and use his [[basic attack]]s and [[item]] actives, and empowers himself with the following effects:
* {{sti|attack speed|{{as|{{fd|1.75}} attack speed}}}} minimum and maximum
* {{sti|life steal|100%}} [[life steal]]
* Deals {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} {{tip|on-hit}} equal to {{as|10% of the target's '''maximum''' health}}, capped at 75 against non-champions
* {{tip|Ghost|Ghosting}}
* One cast of {{ai|Death Surge|Sion}}, which replaces all of his [[champion ability|abilities]]
'''Sion's''' damage to [[structures]] is reduced to 40% under the effects of ''Glory in Death''.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Upon taking fatal damage, Sion enters stasis for 1.5 seconds to reanimate into a frenzy, restoring 100% of his maximum health but Health#Health_as_a_casting_resource 2 − 19 (based on level) health every 0.264, increasing byper subsequent tick. Sion's Unknown value: stil / health regeneration and any healing (except life steal) he receives during this time is 0% effective.
Sion can only move and use his basic attacks and item actives, and empowers himself with the following effects: * 1.75 attack speed minimum and maximum * 100% life steal * Deals bonus physical damage on-hit equal to 10% of the target's maximum health, capped at 75 against non-champions * Ghosting * One cast of Sion's Death Surge, which replaces all of his champion ability
Sion's damage to structures is reduced to 40% under the effects of Glory in Death.
i1.notes:
'''Details'''
* '''Sion's''' death timer starts when he dies and not when ''Glory in Death'' ends.
** If '''Sion''' lives longer than what his death timer lasts for, he will not revive until ''Glory in Death'' has ended. When it ends, he instantly revives. This may result in some odd interactions and bugs at times.
* The effect that heals '''Sion''' back to full health at the start of ''Glory in Death'' cannot be modified by {{tip|Grievous Wounds|healing reductions}} and does not count towards the 'Damage Healed' statistic at the end of game lobby.
* ''Glory in Death'' has a capped 60 seconds duration. If the player manages to survive for so long, '''Sion''' dies instantly, regardless of his current health.
* The healing modifier during ''Glory in Death'' reduces all incoming healing, it does not matter if they are sourced from '''Sion''' himself or an ally. This does not affect life steal.
** This healing modifier stacks additively with {{ii|Spirit Visage}} and does not stack with heal and shield power.
** This means that purchasing ''Spirit Visage'' enables '''Sion''' to have regeneration and use healing effects at 25% effectiveness, and the life steal gained will be increased to 125% as expected.
* The '''fixed''' attack speed is achieved by lowering and increasing the maximum and minimum attack speed to {{sti|attack speed|{{as|1.75|attack speed}}}}, respectively.
** This also means that it's unaffected by other attack speed modifiers for the duration, such as bonus attack speed or {{tip|cripple|cripples}}.
** However, {{ri|Hail of Blades}}, which allows for the normal attack speed cap ({{sti|attack speed|{{as|2.5|attack speed}}}}) to be surpassed, will also break this limit. This means that while it is active, '''Sion''' may exceed his {{sti|attack speed|{{as|1.75|attack speed}}}} cap, but cannot fall below it.
*** This does not apply to {{ri|Lethal Tempo}}.
*** When {{ri|Hail of Blades}} ends, the attack speed cap will revert to {{sti|attack speed|{{as|2.5|attack speed}}}} and not to {{sti|attack speed|{{as|1.75|attack speed}}}}, however '''Sion''' still can't fall below {{sti|attack speed|{{as|1.75|attack speed}}}}.
* Some [[item]] passives do not persist through death and will be lost for the initial few seconds of ''Glory in Death''.
* The bonus on-hit damage granted by ''Glory in Death'' is unaffected by life steal, but is applied against structrures that are not turrets.<!--hmm this may be outdated, I should check this later-->
** However, it can be applied against structures that are not turrets.{{bug}}
* The reduction of damage against structures includes '''Sion's''' attacks as well as on-hit effects that can be applied to structures, such as {{ri|Demolish}}, {{ii|Titanic Hydra}} and the magic damage based on {{as|AP}} conversion based on {{tip|adaptive force}}.
** It even includes {{tip|true damage}} from sources such as {{ii|Elixir of Sorcery}}.{{bug|2}}
* '''Sion''', during ''Glory in Death'', will not lose health while being carried by {{ai|Fate's Call|Kalista}}.
* ''Glory in Death'' does not trigger on [[Decoy|clones]] of '''Sion''', such as with {{ai|Test of Spirit|Illaoi}}.
* ''Glory in Death's'' {{tip|untargetability}} from the {{tip|stasis (buff)|stasis}} does not {{tip|homing projectile destruction|destroy}} in-flight {{tip|projectiles}}.
** Projectiles created while '''Sion''' is in the zombie form will still travel to him even after he dies.
* Upon death, the current cooldowns of '''Sion's''' summoner spells are increased to 4 seconds. Afterwards, he is still unable to use them until he respawns.
** However, it is possible for another lock-out effect to unlock them when their duration ends (excluding {{tip|crowd control}} with the exception of {{tip|stasis}}).
* After ''Glory in Death'' ends, the corpse of '''Sion''' will retain [[unit collision]] despite being dead on the ground.
* Buffs from jungle monsters that '''Sion''' acquired during ''Glory in Death'' will not be lost when the duration ends. ({{bi|Crest of Cinders}}, {{bi|Crest of Insight}})
'''Interactions & Other'''
* By surviving for the full duration of 60 seconds, '''Sion''' will have suffered {{as|{{pp|key=k|36.3654 to 345.4713|round=1}}|health}} in health costs.
* '''Sion''' can also heal from {{stil|spell vamp}}, althought the stat is currently unobtainable and it would be also unusable during ''Glory in Death'', since there would be no available abilities that would apply it.
* Even though its visuals are present, {{ri|Dark Harvest}} can never be gained from '''Sion''' under the effect of ''Glory in Death''.
* At the start of ''Glory in Death'', '''Sion's''' {{tip|mana}} drops to 0, but his {{sti|mana regeneration|{{as|mana regeneration}}}} will remain in effect.
;Zombie info
{{Zombie_state_info}}

i2.name: Death_Surge
description:
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' gains {{sti|ms|{{as|67% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}}{{bug}} that decays over {{fd|2.376}} seconds.

''Once at least one ability has been learned, '''Death Surge''' can be cast using any ability key, even for the abilities that haven't been learned yet.''
i2.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion gains 67% bonus movement speedUnknown value: bug that decays over 2.376 seconds.

Once at least one ability has been learned, Death Surge can be cast using any ability key, even for the abilities that haven't been learned yet.
i2.notes:
* ''Death Surge'' will grant the bonus movement speed after a brief delay.
** The buff is intended to grant 75% decaying movement speed, but instead grants 67% movement speed decaying with -8% per stat update.
*** Precisely this leaves him at {{pp|key=%|type=time passed|0;67;59;51;43;35;27;19;11;3;0|0 to 2.64|formula=67% after 0 to 0.32 seconds, then {{minus}}8% per stat update}} bonus movement speed.
* ''Death Surge'' has a shared cooldown across each ability key, regardless of which key is used to activate it. Thus, activating ''Death Surge'' with any ability key will put the others on cooldown.
* ''Death Surge's'' cooldown resets upon death.
* ''Death Surge's'' cooldown is affected by {{sti|ability haste}} and thus the ability is technically able to be used up to twice during a single instance of ''Glory in Death'', but this isn't practical.
**<!-- Despite showing a shorter cooldown when hovering the ability in the ultimate-slot in the HUD,--> ''Death Surge'' is not affected by {{ri|Ultimate Hunter}}, even if cast from the ultimate ability slot.
** Despite showing the cooldown being reduced, ''Death Surge'' in the ultimate ability slot will be not reduced by {{iis|Axiom Arc}} {{nie|Flux}} on {{tip|takedown}}.{{bug}}
** ''Death Surge's'' cooldown is not reduced by {{iis|Navori Quickblades}} {{nie|Deft Strike}}.

q1.name: Decimating_Smash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' {{tip|channel|charges}} for up to 2 seconds to increase ''Decimating Smash's'' {{sti|range}} over an area, {{tip|airborne|knock up}} duration, {{tip|stun}} duration, and damage every {{fd|0.25}} seconds, which has up to a maximum '''bonus''' for the {{as|'''base''' damage|physical damage}} and up to a 200% '''bonus''' for the {{as|'''scaling''' damage|physical damage}}.

''Decimating Smash'' can be recast within the duration, and automatically does so afterwards. If the charge is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}, ''Decimating Smash'' is placed on a {{sti|cd|2-second}} cooldown.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Sion''' flails his axe in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to enemies hit and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 50% for {{fd|0.25}} seconds. ''Decimating Smash'' deals 150% damage against {{tip|monsters}} and 60% damage against {{tip|minions}}.

If ''Decimating Smash'' was charged for at least 1 second, '''Sion''' instead slams his axe down in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to enemies hit and {{tip|airborne|knocking them up}} for {{pp|type=channel time|0.5 to 1 for 5|1 to 2|formula=0.5+(0.125 every 0.25 seconds). ''Calculation starts at the first second.''|changedisplay = true}} seconds and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{pp|type=channel time|1.25 to 2.25 for 5|1 to 2|formula=1.25+(0.25 every 0.25 seconds). ''Calculation starts at the first second.''|changedisplay = true}} seconds.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion charges for up to 2 seconds to increase Decimating Smash's range over an area, knock up duration, stun duration, and damage every 0.25 seconds, which has up to a maximum bonus for the base damage and up to a 200% bonus for the scaling damage.
Decimating Smash can be recast within the duration, and automatically does so afterwards. If the charge is interrupted, Decimating Smash is placed on a 2-second cooldown.
Recast: Sion flails his axe in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies hit and slowing them by 50% for 0.25 seconds. Decimating Smash deals 150% damage against monsters and 60% damage against minions.
If Decimating Smash was charged for at least 1 second, Sion instead slams his axe down in the target direction, dealing physical damage to enemies hit and knocking them up for 1 to 2 ‒ undefined seconds and stunning them for 1 to 2 ‒ undefined seconds.

[[File:Sion hitbox area.png|thumb|For the target to be hit, their center needs to be inside the red or blue areas (based on charge time), and their edge must hit the yellow part of the cone. If their edge also hits the white part of the cone they will be excluded from being hit. Cone is at 16 degrees and starts 800 range behind Sion's center. White cone has a radius of 720, while yellow cone has a radius of 1550.]]
* {{Correction}} The in-game description incorrectly states that the AD ratio is {{as|{{ap|45 to 95}}% AD}}, increased up to {{as|{{ap|135 to 285}}% AD}} based on channel time.
* '''Sion''' himself remains {{tip|lockout|locked out}} of all actions for {{fd|0.25}} seconds when releasing ''Decimating Smash''.
** Trying to cast {{ai|Soul Furnace|Sion}} will buffer the cast until '''Sion''' is no longer locked out or otherwise prevented from casting it, while {{ai|Roar of the Slayer|Sion}} and {{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion}} will not buffer.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will also resist the application of the {{tip|stun}}.
* Since the {{tip|stun}} duration is longer than the {{tip|airborne}} duration, and both start at the same time, {{tip|Tenacity}} is still fully effective against ''Decimating Smash'' up to a cap.
** This virtual cap is 60%-55.5% {{sti|Tenacity}} based on channel time beyond 1 second. Every value below this cap will lower the CC duration with no diminished returns.
* A flash of the axe and change in brightness of the indicator on the ground indicates when the 1 second time frame is reached.
* The damage of ''Decimating Smash'' is calculated when it is released. Gaining {{as|AD}} or upgrading the ability during its channel will update the damage of the coming hit. 
** Even though the [[cooldown]] starts when the ability is released, it will not be changed by gaining or losing [[ability haste|AH]], or upgrading the ability, during the cast time.
* The indicator is visible to the enemy only if they {{tip|Sight|see}} '''Sion''' himself.
** If the channel is released before 1 second, enemies may see a particle at the far end of the hitbox, if it itself isn't outside of their {{tip|Sight|vision}}.
** If the channel is released after 1 second, the only remaining indication is the visual effects and audio that plays on any units the spell strikes (these play on-target), provided the enemy does have {{tip|Sight|vision}} on those.
* Forced movement without a {{tip|stun}} component (or the stun being {{tip|cleanse|cleansed}} previously) will not stop '''Sion''' from starting or continuing to channel. Its direction will not change with '''Sion's''' travel, however the location will update with him.
** The location of the indicator updates at the ''beginning'' of the ability, at ''1 second'' and at ''release''.
* The indicator of the ability is slightly shorter at its front than the hitbox of the ability is for {{csl|Sion}}, {{csl|Sion|Mecha Zero}} and related skins and chromas, while on {{csl|Sion|Worldbreaker}}, the indicator is slightly thinner at the front than the hitbox is, instead.

w1.name: Soul_Furnace
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Sion''' gains {{sti|health|{{as|4 '''bonus''' health}}}} whenever he kills an {{tt|enemy|see notes for details}}, increased to {{as|15|health}} for large enemies and {{tip|takedown|takedowns}} against enemy {{tip|champions}}.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' gains a {{tip|shield}} that lasts for up to 6 seconds. ''Soul Furnace'' can be recast after 3 seconds while the shield holds, and does so automatically at the end of the duration.
{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Sion''' consumes the shield to deal {{as|magic damage}} to nearby enemies, capped at 400 against {{tip|minions}} and {{tip|monsters}}.
''Both of Soul Furnace's casts can be activated during '''Sion's''' other abilities, other than the release of {{ai|Q|Sion}}.''
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Sion gains 4 bonus health whenever he kills an enemy, increased to 15 for large enemies and takedowns against enemy champions.
Active: Sion gains a shield that lasts for up to 6 seconds. Soul Furnace can be recast after 3 seconds while the shield holds, and does so automatically at the end of the duration.
Recast: Sion consumes the shield to deal magic damage to nearby enemies, capped at 400 against minions and monsters.
Both of Soul Furnace's casts can be activated during Sion's other abilities, other than the release of Sion's Q.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|40 to 140}} {{as|(+ 40% AP)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|10 to 14}}% of target's '''maximum''' health)}}}}
w1.notes:
* A buff icon in the HUD will show the current shield strength, so that the player can better calculate the timing of the second cast.
** The initial shown value does not interact with {{sti|Heal and Shield Power|shield strength modifiers|link=true}}. Whenever the shield takes damage, it updates to the proper current shield amount, however.
*The initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
**Detonating the ability manually does not.
* Gaining or losing AP or health, or ranking up the skill while the shield is active will not change its shield value but it will change the damage of the shield's detonation.
* The [[cooldown]] of ''Soul Furnace'' begins once the shield is removed.
** Gaining or losing {{sti|ability haste}} between the first cast and breaking of the shield will affect the resuming cooldown accordingly.
* ''Soul Furnace'' also automatically detonates if '''Sion''' is killed without the shield being destroyed, e.g. by dying to the {{tip|Nexus Obelisk}}, ''even if'' Sion could not have detonated it manually yet.
* ''Soul Furnace's'' bonus health can be obtained by any of '''Sion's''' damage sources (basic attacks, abilities, summoner spells, item actives).
** This does not include ''last hits'' transferred to '''Sion''' artificially, through effects such as {{ii|Relic Shield|Spoils of War}}.
** If the [[gold efficiency]] of a {{ii|Ruby Crystal}} is considered 100%, each ''last hit'' or {{tip|takedown|''takedown''}} after ''Soul Furnace'' has been learned can be considered worth an extra {{g|{{fd|10.{{recurring|6}}}}}} or {{g|40g}}.
* '''Sion''' must learn ''Soul Furnace'' before he can stack up its passive.
* '''Sion''' does not gain bonus health from units that enter {{tip|resurrection}} on-death.
* Killing the following unit types grants '''Sion''' {{as|15 '''bonus''' health}}:
** {{tip|champion|Champions}} ([[kill]]s and [[assist]]s)
** {{tip|minion|Large minions}} and {{tip|monster|large monsters}} (including both summoned and pit {{ui|Rift Herald}})
** {{tip|pet|Large pets}} - Explicitly {{ai|Summon: Tibbers|Annie|Tibbers}}, {{ai|Daisy!|Ivern|Daisy}} and {{ai|Eulogy of the Isles|Yorick|The Maiden}}
* Killing the following unit types grants '''Sion''' {{as|4 '''bonus''' health}}:
** {{tip|Minions}} and {{tip|monster|small monsters}}
** {{tip|Wards}} and other [[champion summoned units]] (e.g. {{ai|Noxious Trap|Teemo}}, {{ai|Powder Keg|Gangplank}}, {{ai|Dark Procession|Yorick}})
** All {{tip|pet|pets}}, with the exceptions of those listed above and below
** {{tip|Clone|Clones}}
* Killing the following unit types grants '''Sion''' ''no'' {{as|'''bonus''' health}}:
** {{tip|Turrets}} (including {{ai|Shurima's Legacy|Azir|Sun Disk}}) and other [[structures]]
** [[Jungle plants]] (destroying which does not grant kill credit).
** Units destroyed by 'trampling' such as {{cai|Rampant Growth|Zyra|seeds}}, {{cai|Cell Division|Zac|goo}} or {{cai|Tunnel|Rek'Sai|tunnels}}.

e1.name: Roar_of_the_Slayer
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' bellows a shockwave in the target direction that deals {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit, {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for {{fd|2.5}} seconds, and {{sti|armor penetration|{{as|reducing their armor by 20%}}}} for 4 seconds.

If the target is a {{tip|minion}} or non-epic {{tip|monster}}, they are also {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{fd|0.75}} seconds and {{tip|airborne|knocked back}} for up to 1350 units further, though not through terrain, applying ''Roar of the Slayer's'' effects to enemies they pass through as well as briefly granting {{tip|sight}} of the area around their trajectory.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion bellows a shockwave in the target direction that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit, slowing them for 2.5 seconds, and reducing their armor by 20% for 4 seconds.
If the target is a minion or non-epic monster, they are also stunned for 0.75 seconds and knocked back for up to 1350 units further, though not through terrain, applying Roar of the Slayer's effects to enemies they pass through as well as briefly granting sight of the area around their trajectory.
e1.notes:
* Minions or monsters that are flung away are immune to minion damage and take their damage once they are stopped if they would die to ''Roar of the Slayer's'' damage, by either colliding with terrain, reaching the end of their trajectory, or having their displacement interrupted.
* Unlike the intial single-target [[projectile]], a thrown minion or monster is not blocked by {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}}.
* Gaining or losing {{as|AP}}, or upgrading the ability while its projectile is traveling will change its damage for every future hit. This applies to both the intial single-target projectile, as well as the minion-projectile.

r1.name: Unstoppable_Onslaught
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' becomes {{tip|Cc-immune|immune to crowd control}} and {{tip|ghosted}} and, after a {{tt|brief delay|0.05 (Estimated)}}, {{tip|channel|charges}} forward in the direction of the cursor for up to 8 seconds, during which he is able to steer at a slow turn rate while automatically navigating his movement. ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' can be recast after {{tt|{{fd|0.4}}|Estimated}} seconds during the channel.

The charge ramps up '''Sion's''' {{tt|{{as|movement speed}}|Post movement speed caps}} at the time of cast by {{as|40 movement speed}} every {{fd|0.1}} seconds, up to {{as|950 '''total''' movement speed}}.

At the end of the charge's duration, '''Sion''' {{tip|lunge|leaps}} forward {{tt|300|Can end up being slightly shorter, but not related to to Sion's speed}} units, landing after {{fd|0.55}} seconds and slamming the {{tt|ground|500 range, estimated}} beneath him. '''Sion''' will stop upon {{tt|colliding|150 units in front of Sion for the charge and point blank for the leap}} with an enemy champion or {{tt|terrain|Includes structures, read notes for details on player-generated terrain}} during the charge, ending ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' with a slam. Crashing into terrain {{tip|stun|stuns}} '''Sion''' for {{fd|0.5}} seconds.

Enemies hit by '''Sion's''' charge are dealt {{as|physical damage}}. The '''base''' damage increases by {{pp|type=channel time|changedisplay=true|key=%|0 to 500/3 for 4|0 to 3|formula=55.55% every 1 second. ''This is capped at 3 seconds.''}} and the {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' AD}}}} ratio increases by {{pp|type=channel time|changedisplay=true|key=%|0 to 100 for 4|0 to 3|formula=33.33% every 1 second. ''This is capped at 3 seconds.''}}.

Enemies, including {{tip|turret|turrets}}, hit by the slam are dealt the same {{as|physical damage}} and are {{tip|slow|slowed}} for 3 seconds. Enemies in a {{tt|smaller radius|350 range, estimated}} are also {{tip|airborne|pulled}} towards '''Sion''' over {{fd|0.5}} seconds and become {{tip|stun|stunned}} after a brief delay for {{pp|type=channel time|label1=seconds|changedisplay=true|0.25 to 1.75|0 to 3 by 1}}, increased to {{pp|type=channel time|label1=seconds|changedisplay=true|0.75 to 1.75|0 to 3 by 1}} if they collided during the leap.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion becomes immune to crowd control and ghosted and, after a brief delay, charges forward in the direction of the cursor for up to 8 seconds, during which he is able to steer at a slow turn rate while automatically navigating his movement. Unstoppable Onslaught can be recast after 0.4 seconds during the channel.
The charge ramps up Sion's movement speed at the time of cast by 40 movement speed every 0.1 seconds, up to 950 total movement speed.
At the end of the charge's duration, Sion leaps forward 300 units, landing after 0.55 seconds and slamming the ground beneath him. Sion will stop upon colliding with an enemy champion or terrain during the charge, ending Unstoppable Onslaught with a slam. Crashing into terrain stuns Sion for 0.5 seconds.
Enemies hit by Sion's charge are dealt physical damage. The base damage increases by 0 to 3 ‒ undefined and the bonus AD ratio increases by 0 to 3 ‒ undefined.
Enemies, including turrets, hit by the slam are dealt the same physical damage and are slowed for 3 seconds. Enemies in a smaller radius are also pulled towards Sion over 0.5 seconds and become stunned after a brief delay for 0 to 3 by 1 ‒ undefined, increased to 0 to 3 by 1 ‒ undefined if they collided during the leap.
leveling: {{st|Minimum Physical Damage|{{ap|150|300|450}} {{as|(+ 40% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Maximum Physical Damage|{{ap|400|800|1200}} {{as|(+ 80% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
r1.notes:
* When '''Sion''' casts ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' a global warning can be heard.
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' does not apply the knock up nor stun to enemies from slamming on collision with terrain.
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' does not {{tip|airborne|knock up}} non-champions hit by the charge.{{bug}}
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' can be activated twice '''or''' held down and released on '''both''' normal cast and quick cast. There is no other difference between normal cast and quick cast for this ability, either.
*The initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
**The recast does not.
* An enemy can only be affected by ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' once every 1 second.
* After reaching maximum damage and stun duration (at 3 seconds) '''Sion''' will transition from using his ''haste'' animation to his unique ''charging'' one.
** Reaching the threshold on {{csl|Sion|Mecha Zero}} changes his particle effects instead, most notably the 'Boosters' behind the vehicle.
** The turning angle is not based on time and can easily be seen in practice when a '''Sion''' ''charges'' in-place due to bugs.
* '''Sion's''' movement speed gains during the charge are unaffected by [[Movement_speed#Movement_speed_caps|movement speed caps]]. Effects that would increase or decrease his movement speed do not affect him as well.
** {{cai|I|Nami}} is the only known effect that can affect '''Sion's''' {{as|movement speed}} during the ''charge'' and that can place him above the normal MS value. However, without further multipliers, surpassing the {{as|950 movement speed}} cap will require {{ci|Nami}} to have over {{as|2150 ability power}}.
* '''Sion''' does not always crash with terrain immediately upon touching it, enabling the player to turn beyond his maximum turning angle.
** Casting the ability at point blank of a terrain will most often automatically change the ''charge's'' direction.
** This is not usually possible with player-generated terrain.
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' cannot ''charge'' through but can ''leap'' over [[Terrain#Player-Generated|player-generated terrain]].
* '''Sion''' loses the {{tip|cc-immune|crowd control immunity}} after finishing the {{tip|lunge|leap}}.
* '''Sion''' is not immune to {{tip|crowd control}} applied by his allies during ''Unstoppable Onslaught''. For example, a {{ui|Blast Cone}} triggered by an ally will cause the {{tip|channel}} to be {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}.
** An allied {{cai|Tempered Fate|Bard}} will be resisted however.
*** If it hits '''Sion''' during the {{fd|0.05}}-second delay before he starts the channel, he will not resist the effect and will initiate the ''slam'' immediately while in {{tip|stasis}}.
* '''Sion''' is immune to the {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}} for 2 seconds after completing the slam after the channel ends.{{bug}}
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' {{tt|cannot strike the same non-champion twice in less than 1 second|Like most AOE spells or spells with traveling hitboxes, it places a marker buff on struck targets. This one lasts 1 second}}.
* Even though the [[cooldown]] of ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' starts at the end of the effect, gaining or losing [[ability haste]], or upgrading the ability during the effect, will not change the resuming cooldown.
* {{tip|Cleanse|Removing}} the {{tip|airborne}} before {{fd|0.5}} seconds will '''not''' prevent the {{tip|stun}} from being applied.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will also resist the application of the {{tip|stun}}.
* '''Sion''' can occasionally cast ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' while {{tip|root|rooted}}. In this case, he will stand in place until the root's debuff duration ends. During this time, the damage, stun duration and movement speed granted by the ability will still ramp up, and enemies that come into contact with him will be affected by the collision normally.{{bug}}
** A similar case allows him to cast it during crowd control that would disable it. However, the channel would be interrupted almost immediately, and he will initiate the leap as well.
* {{ai|Fate's Call|Kalista}} deferment of ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' will still allow '''Sion''' to leap forward at the end of the channel.
* Moving the cursor onto HUD elements (e.g [[Map (League of Legends)|mini map]] / champion portraits) does ''not'' jeopardize the cast and steering of ''Unstoppable Onslaught''. The targeting will act as if the ground was targeted below the display element.
* {{Pending for test}} The distance between '''Sion's''' center and the center of the ground ''slam'' scales slightly with movement speed. This is suspected because running into a wall within half a second of ''charge'' time after starting at multiple thousands of movement speed shows a considerable difference, however this could also be due to a bug.
* {{Pending for test}} The ''leap'' appears to always have the same speed regardless of '''Sion's''', at roughly 750.
